headline.main: IDLE TREE SPURS DRIVE FOR FRANCE; Lights in Plaza Square Will Signal Each $1,000 Raised for Men in Prison Camps RED CROSS TO SEND BOXES Escaped Prisoner in Appeal at Relief Center Tells of the Meager Diet of Men

lead_paragraph: Yesterday saw a Christmas tree on Plaza Square spreading its branches in a message to the 1,500,000 Frenchmen still left in German prison camps. In nights to come, each lighted bulb will represent the acquisition of $1,000 toward $30,000 now being sought by the Coordinating Council of French Relief Societies, on whose doorstep at 4 West Fifty-eighth Street the tree has been placed.
abstract: Attends French Relief Coordinating Council luncheon, N Y C; por
